sanskrit_verse:
अनुबन्धं परिज्ञाय देशकालौ च तत्त्वतः ।
सारापराधो चालोक्य दण्डं दण्ड्येषु पातयेत् ॥ ८.१२६॥
transliteration:
anubandhaṃ parijñāya deśakālau ca tattvataḥ |
sārāparādho cālokya daṇḍaṃ daṇḍyeṣu pātayet || 8.126||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having ascertained the causal linkage, time, place, and the essential nature of the offense, the governing authority shall administer corrective measures proportionate to the gravity of the transgression.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from conscious discernment of causality and context
Causation must be traced through space, time, and substance
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by understanding the actor's awareness of consequence
Restoration logic requires proportional response aligned with disruption caused
Consciousness alignment demands correction rooted in truth, not vengeance
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse mandates that judicial authority rests on complete knowledge of causal sequence, temporal and spatial context, and the substantive essence of the act. Responsibility is assigned based on capacity for dharma-viveka, not mere physical agency. Correctional measures are applied only after ensuring alignment with cosmic justice (Ṛta), never punitive reaction.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyāya here denotes pramāṇa-grounded cognition leading to anupūrvaśaḥ-based intervention. The sequential manifestation of error is observed without attribution of malice. Responsibility is calibrated according to perceptual clarity at time of action. There is no infliction of pain; only guided completion of karmic imbalance through conscious restitution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate causal-chain reconstruction session with involved parties
Assign reflective completion task aligned with violated principle
Engage community witness protocol to restore collective dharmic field
Activate svadharma-realignment module via personalized sankalpa process
Deploy akrodha-pratipaksha_bhavana interface to neutralize residual agitation
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed: Dharma flows from pure consciousness, not coercion. Justice is restoration through alignment, not punishment through force. Reality responds to truth, not fear.
